data.title: Business
data.text: Horrible place to stay. Advise to take the time to find a place where your not looked upon as prey. Many rooms have family living in them on the monthly basis. Which makes the parking lot there yard. In the back is a trailer modular home converted into 5 rooms. There caged off from the rest of the motel but is still a spooky environment. The manager is obnioxly rude, very evident that money is his only concern. Mostly due to the managers attitude, I recommend spending the extra ten and getting a place down the road.

data.title: Scary place
data.text:
I would never stay there again.  Felt like an intruder with permanent guests staring.  Rooms small and old.  
Did not feel safe there at all.  It is very close to the mall, on a main busy street.  Booked on line based on location, but not the place for me.  Never again.

data.title: There is no continential breakfast
data.text: We paid $65.00 for a room which should have been $45.00 Its false advertising to say you have a breakfast only to find its coffee and a packaged bun . This is not even close to what a continential breakfast should be  This motel is very old and sits on the busiest street in Great Falls . Never again

data.title: Manager snoops
data.text: Worst hotel experience ever. Checked in and about 3 hours later manager was leaned up against my door listening to my conversations. I confronted him on it and he tells me he has the right to know what's going on in his hotel. Sorry but he dont have the right to do what he was doing. Turned into an argument and he told me to vacate the property. I paid for 3 nights. He refused to refund me any money. DONT STAY HERE. I found graystone inn downtown great falls and loved that place.

data.title: Crappy manager
data.text: Me my brother and his wife stayed at this motel for about a month and the manager was seen creeping around our windows and door and standing there trying to listen in. Manager lies alot. He had no problem with us paying him late. Then denies saying that and kickes us out. He locked us out and refuses to let us get our stuff out. He lied to the owner to make him self look good and cuz if owner knew the truth about him then he would loose his job. I rate this place zero stars. Worst place ever.

data.title: Ask before you book!
data.text: I spent 6 miserable nights on a bed with mushy coils and a hard metal edge.  I only stayed because I couldn't afford the high prices of the other establishments.  When I checked out a day early, the owner asked me why I didn't come to him to see about another room.  Well, things were pretty full several nights and frankly the condition of the room and property didn't lead me to believe that the owner cared about his property or his customers.  He claimed that he had a few new mattresses and more were coming.  I can only say, "Ask before you book!"

data.title: o k for a night
data.text: We knew that this is an old place , booked here for one night heading to Helena. Rooms are old and small but very clean.   Not much for parking.  Great location if you need to shop at the mall.  Easy to walk over, Mexican restaurant next door was good  . They have Wi Fi  , but a very low signal.   If you get a good deal on price line , then ok to stay here,     probably wont stay here again .

data.title: Old Motel but no problems
data.text: There were very few rooms available near 10th Avenue due to the MAGI Expo and the Toy Show so we booked at the Plaza Inn.The motel is old with an ancient heating system but it put out a lot of heat when requireed [a good job because it was pretty cold out]. We had a King-sized bed with a new mattress. The room was small but it had a fridge,microwave and TV. The staff were extremely friendly and courteous. There is a continental breakfast but we never went [we were never up in time!] We had no problems at all.Location is great for us because it is et the Holiday Mall and only afew minutes walk to the Prospector Casino where we meet our friends and 50 yards to the 24hr Town Pump gas station/convenience store and easy walking distance to a variety of restaurants.

data.title: Old but Clean - nice owner
data.text: The owner has 3 motels in the area. This one is right next to the mall & other shopping, so the location is great. Although it is old, it appears quite clean. You may need to ask for more towels or soap, as we did, but they are dependable. The Canadian couple in the next room say they stay here every time they come to the US for shopping. There is also no state tax in Montana. The week we stayed was the week of the State Fair, so all motels were quite full. Thankfully we found a room for 3 nights & they accept well-behaved pets. The Canadians said the owner accommodates them every time they come and made room for their visit in spite of the Fair. Yes, they need to supply more coffee with the water - the only complaint. If they read this, I'm sure they'll heed the hints.

data.title: Old but adequate
data.text: We had a room with a king size bed, refrigerator and microwave. The room was clean and adequate for our needs. They also will take a pet for an extra $10. The location is great. One block to the mall. The motel is on the main drag of Great Falls but still very quiet. Mexican restaurant next door and a sushi place across the street. The manager was very helpful. They claim a continental breakfast, but it was only weak coffee and a pastry. The bed was very comfortable. Acceptable for the price.

data.title: Skidd Hotel
data.text:
We pulled into Great Falls late on evening without reservations and unfortunatly found this place available. I asked if rooms were clean and clerk stated extremelly clean. Well upon entering the room I knew we made a huge mistake. The door frame and jams were busted ( i presume from being kicked in) the dead bolt didnt work at all. The carpet was disgusting, we didnt remove our shoes. I grabbed the ice bucket and looked for the vending machines,,hmmm,,off to office,,he said he would fill it and he did right out of own freezer,ewwww...back in hotel now looking for cups,,none!..off to office to grab 2 plastic cups..There were drunk people hanging alll around the entire motel, didnt sleep much wasnt sure if me bike was still gonna be there in the morning.
I have stayed at alot of hotel/motels by far the absolute worse!!!!!!
